snippet: A new alliance wants zoning rules eased more than the city administration has proposed to encourage construction of towers around Grand Central Terminal.
abstract: Prominent developers forge an unusual alliance with labor and the construction industry to lobby for rules to allow a new crop of New York City skyscrapers around Grand Central Terminal in Midtown; alliance is pressing the Bloomberg administration to loosen proposed zoning changes so that more skyscrapers can be built on more sites, at quicker pace and lower cost.
lead_paragraph: A new alliance wants zoning rules eased more than the city administration has proposed to encourage construction of towers around Grand Central Terminal.

headline.seo: New York Developers and Unions Seek Eased Limits on Midtown Projects
headline.main: Developers and Unions Seek Eased Limits on Midtown Projects
headline.print_headline: Developers Join Labor to Back Eased Limits on Midtown Work
